name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic iron lattice tower that offers breathtaking views of Paris from its observation decks.

name: Mont Saint-Michel
description: A stunning island commune featuring a medieval abbey perched atop rocky cliffs, surrounded by tidal waters.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The world's largest art museum, home to thousands of works, including the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: A symbol of royal opulence, this grand palace boasts stunning gardens and historically significant architecture.

name: Provence Lavender Fields
description: Vast fields of fragrant lavender bloom in summer, creating a picturesque landscape that attracts photographers and nature lovers.

name: Château de Chambord
description: A masterpiece of the French Renaissance, this chateau is renowned for its distinctive architectural features and expansive grounds.

name: Gorges du Verdon
description: Often referred to as the 'Grand Canyon of Europe,' this stunning river canyon is perfect for hiking, kayaking, and breathtaking views.

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: A Gothic chapel famous for its magnificent stained glass windows that depict biblical scenes and flood the interior with colorful light.

name: Côte d'Azur
description: The glamorous French Riviera is known for its beautiful beaches, luxury resorts, and vibrant nightlife amidst stunning coastal scenery.

name: Dune du Pilat
description: The tallest sand dune in Europe, offering panoramic views of the Atlantic Ocean and the surrounding pine forests.

name: Carcassonne
description: A medieval fortress town with well-preserved walls and towers, featuring a fairy-tale atmosphere and rich history.

name: Chartres Cathedral
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this cathedral is known for its stunning Gothic architecture and remarkable stained glass.

name: Étretat Cliffs
description: Famous for their dramatic white chalk cliffs and natural arches, these coastal formations offer breathtaking views of the Normandy coastline.

name: Saint-Tropez
description: A famous resort town known for its beautiful beaches, luxury yachts, and vibrant nightlife, attracting celebrities and tourists alike.

name: Pont du Gard
description: An ancient Roman aqueduct bridge recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site, showcasing impressive engineering from antiquity.

name: Colmar
description: A charming Alsatian town with colorful half-timbered houses, canals, and a rich history, often referred to as the 'Venice of France'.

name: Les Calanques National Park
description: A stunning coastal park known for its dramatic cliffs, turquoise waters, and beautiful hiking trails.

name: Bordeaux Wine Region
description: Renowned for its world-class vineyards, this region offers wine tours, tastings, and picturesque landscapes.

name: Île de Ré
description: A beautiful island known for its sandy beaches, charming villages, and cycling paths, perfect for a relaxing getaway.

name: Cimetiere du Pere Lachaise
description: The largest cemetery in Paris, famous for the graves of notable figures like Jim Morrison and Oscar Wilde, set in a beautiful, park-like environment.

name: Cascades du Hérisson
description: A spectacular series of waterfalls located in the Jura Mountains, ideal for hiking and enjoying nature.

name: Amiens Cathedral
description: The largest Gothic cathedral in France, known for its impressive facade and stunning interior, including remarkable stained glass.

name: Lascaux Caves
description: Famous for its prehistoric cave paintings, these caves offer a glimpse into early human creativity and history.

name: Rocamadour
description: A stunning clifftop village known for its historic pilgrimage site and breathtaking views of the Alzou valley.

name: Château de Chenonceau
description: Also known as the 'Ladies' Castle,' this exquisite château is built over the Cher River and features beautifully landscaped gardens.

name: Les Baux-de-Provence
description: A historic village perched atop a rocky outcrop, offering stunning views and fascinating ruins from the Middle Ages.

name: Dinan
description: A medieval town with cobbled streets, half-timbered houses, and a stunning castle, reflecting the charm of Brittany.

name: Palace of the Popes
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this impressive Gothic palace was the residence of the popes in the 14th century.

name: Saint-Malo
description: A historic fortified town with beautiful beaches, cobblestone streets, and rich maritime history.

name: Château de Fougères
description: One of the largest medieval fortresses in Europe, offering a glimpse into the past with its impressive towers and walls.

name: Les Jardins de Marqueyssac
description: Beautifully landscaped gardens with stunning views of the Dordogne Valley, featuring topiary and picturesque walking paths.

name: Etretat
description: Known for its striking chalk cliffs and scenic beaches, this coastal town has inspired many artists over the years.

name: Abbey of Saint-Savin
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, famous for its stunning Romanesque frescoes and beautiful architecture.

name: Giverny
description: The home of Claude Monet, this village is renowned for its beautiful gardens and the iconic water lily pond that inspired many of his paintings.

name: Puy du Fou
description: A historical theme park that features spectacular shows and reenactments of significant events from French history.

name: Le Mont-Dore
description: A beautiful mountain resort known for its skiing in winter and hiking trails in summer, offering stunning views of the Auvergne region.

name: Vézelay
description: A historic hilltop village known for its stunning basilica and as a starting point for the pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela.

name: Château de Gien
description: A historic castle overlooking the Loire River, known for its beautiful architecture and rich history.

name: Gorges de l'Ardèche
description: A breathtaking river canyon famous for its stunning landscapes, natural arch, and opportunities for canoeing and hiking.

name: Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie
description: The largest science museum in Europe, featuring interactive exhibits, a planetarium, and an IMAX theater.

name: Les Halles
description: A vibrant shopping district that combines a historic market atmosphere with modern retail experiences, dining, and entertainment.

name: Château de Saint-Germain-en-Laye
description: A royal château with beautiful gardens, known as the birthplace of King Louis XIV and now housing a museum of archaeology.

name: Lake Annecy
description: Often called the 'Venice of the Alps,' this stunning lake is surrounded by mountains and is perfect for swimming, sailing, and hiking.

name: Basilica of Saint-Sernin
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the largest Romanesque churches in Europe, known for its impressive architecture.

name: La Rochelle
description: A picturesque port city with historic architecture, beautiful sea views, and a vibrant atmosphere, perfect for exploring.

name: Basilique du Sacré-Cœur
description: A stunning basilica located on Montmartre hill, offering panoramic views of Paris and a beautiful interior.

name: Côte de Granit Rose
description: Known for its unique pink granite rocks and stunning coastal scenery, this area is perfect for hiking and beachcombing.

name: Abbey of Cluny
description: Once one of the most powerful abbeys in medieval Europe, its ruins and museum offer insight into monastic life.

name: Les Halles de Lyon Paul Bocuse
description: A gastronomic market showcasing the best of Lyon's culinary offerings, from local cheeses to pastries.

name: Château de Montsoreau
description: A unique château built on the banks of the Loire River, now housing a contemporary art museum.

name: Parc National des Écrins
description: A stunning national park in the French Alps, known for its breathtaking mountain scenery and outdoor activities.

name: Grotte de Lascaux II
description: A replica of the original Lascaux Caves, showcasing ancient cave paintings that date back thousands of years.

name: Château de Brézé
description: Known for its impressive underground tunnels and unique architecture, this château is a hidden gem in the Loire Valley.

name: Calvados Boulard
description: A distillery offering tours and tastings of the famous Calvados apple brandy, set in a picturesque Normandy landscape.

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: An art museum housed in a former railway station, featuring an extensive collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces.

name: Île d'Aix
description: A small, car-free island known for its beautiful beaches, charming streets, and the historic Fort Boyard.

name: Parc de la Tête d'Or
description: A large urban park featuring a lake, botanical gardens, and a zoo, perfect for leisurely strolls and picnics.

name: Château de Chaumont
description: Famous for its stunning gardens and annual garden festival, this château offers beautiful views of the Loire Valley.

name: Bayeux Tapestry
description: An extraordinary embroidery depicting the Norman Conquest of England, now housed in a dedicated museum.

name: La Maison de la Magie
description: A unique museum dedicated to magic and illusion, featuring fascinating exhibits and live performances.

name: Château de Vitré
description: A well-preserved medieval castle surrounded by charming streets, showcasing a rich history and stunning architecture.

name: Puy de Sancy
description: The highest peak in the Massif Central, offering hiking, skiing, and breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

name: Les Machines de l'île
description: An artistic amusement park where giant mechanical creatures, including a moving elephant, come to life.

name: Château de Hautefort
description: A stunning château surrounded by beautiful gardens, known for its rich history and picturesque setting.

name: Musée Picasso
description: A museum dedicated to the works of Pablo Picasso, showcasing an extensive collection of his paintings, sculptures, and sketches.

name: Futuroscope
description: A futuristic theme park featuring innovative attractions and multimedia experiences, ideal for families and thrill-seekers.

name: Château de Castelnaud
description: A medieval castle overlooking the Dordogne River, featuring exhibits on medieval warfare and stunning views.

name: Saint-Emilion
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its picturesque vineyards, historic architecture, and delicious wines.

name: Cité de Carcassonne
description: An impressive fortress town with a double wall and medieval architecture, often considered one of the best-preserved in Europe.

name: Cascades de Gairaut
description: Beautiful waterfalls located in a picturesque park, offering a peaceful escape from the bustling city.

name: La Route des Vins
description: A scenic wine route through picturesque villages and vineyards, known for its charming architecture and delicious wines.

name: Viaduc de Millau
description: The tallest bridge in the world, offering breathtaking views of the Tarn Valley and showcasing modern engineering.

name: Basilique de Saint-Denis
description: A Gothic masterpiece and the burial site of French kings, notable for its stunning architecture and historical significance.

name: Île d'Oléron
description: A beautiful island known for its sandy beaches, charming villages, and delicious seafood, perfect for a relaxing getaway.

name: Château de Brissac
description: The tallest château in France, known for its opulent interiors and beautiful gardens, often referred to as the 'Giant of the Loire.'
